Project.name: Sequential Demo for AS3
Project.Description: This demo illustrates the use of the AsyncCommand utility to execute a series of commands, some of which must complete asynchronous operations before the next command can be executed.
Project.ReleaseNotes:
Features in Version 1.0
  • Executes an AsyncMacroCommand which in turn executes a series of AsyncCommands and SimpleCommands.
  • The AsyncCommands use simple Timers to represent asynchronous tasks.
  • Standard and MultiCore versions included.
Project.Installation:
Installing the Project Source Code From the archive
  • Download the latest source code archive.
  • Unzip the source code zip to any folder on your disk.
  • For instance: c:\development\
  • You will see a Sequential_X_Y (where X_Y is version) source folder.
  • For instance: c:\development\Sequential_X_Y
From the Repository
  • Use your favorite SVN client to retrieve the latest source code release from the repository.
Setup and Compile the Demo Using Flex Builder 3
  • Create a new ActionScript Project called 'Sequential' in Flex Builder 3, pointing to the new Sequential source folder.
  • Add the required libraries to the Sequential project's build path.
  • From the Flex Builder menu do: Project -> Properties -> Flex Build Path -> Library Path -> Add SWC Folder
  • Browse and select: Sequential/lib-standard or Sequential/lib-multicore depending on the version of PureMVC you will be using.
  • Set the Main Source Folder to src-standard or src-multicore depending on the version of PureMVC you will be using.
  • Run Sequential.as
